alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Fergus County below 4500ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 20 at 3:05AM MST until January 23 at 6:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations mostly between 8 and 14 inches possible, with higher amounts on the mountain peaks. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, and tire chains may be required for some vehicles over mountain passes. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
